intro: Phoenicanthemum macklottianum, commonly known as the Macklott's phoenicanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are arranged in a cylindrical shape, typical of the genus Phoenicanthemum. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
